Articles.Content:
Rules are simple: a description must hint the plot of the movie, be witty and funny, and not too short. Users guess, who guessed correctly the first will make his description next.

Example: a lone father comes to his daughter's room and throws books to attract her attention.

Of course, it's Interstellar

My turn.

During a strike, an ordinary worker sabotages the mine and kills the greedy capitalist. << correct my English if necessary.

Please, don't post descriptions before the last one is cracked. Everybody cracks yours if you cracked the other one.

I assume SciFi movies as our denominator here.

Edited November 25, 2014 by Kulebron

Men In Black?

A person discovers her magical powers at age 8. At age 21, she freezes her country, and her sister tries to help her melt the snow.

uuum... Peter Pan?

Just kidding, its Frozen

A father tries to find his son with help from someone with Short Term Memory loss

fidning nemo.

aliens come out of the sea and are hit with massive boats by robots.

Pacific Rim

Alone, waiting to go home, getting sicker every day, then an accident happens...

None of the above. Please hold on with your descriptions, let's crack the first one.

I promise to give hints in the next page if it's too hard. But it's not

During a strike, an ordinary worker sabotages the mine and kills the greedy capitalist.
Armageddon?
No. The plot seems too far from the description.

I'll need a hint then

.
Ok, first hint: I see how you came to Armageddon, but this description is almost literal.
I read a book called "Germinal" by Zola. The plot sounds familiar but I have not seen a movie version of it. That is my guess.

My second guess is "Snowpiercer". The train is not exactly a mine but essentially, it is. The children on the train are essentially "mined" since they are precious resource on the train since only they can keep the train moving.

None of these, and the description is very literal. It's sci-fi.

During a strike, an ordinary worker sabotages the mine and kills the greedy capitalist, freeing poor people who suffered under his rule.

Edited November 26, 2014 by Kulebron
I've only seen three Russian films. Solaris, How I Ended This Summer, and The Island. I don't think I will be able to solve this!
It's American and very famous The funny bit is that I wrapped it in completely different ideology.
Atlas Shrugged?

no.

10char
V for Vendetta.
not v for vendetta

Star Wars

There's a strike on the Deathstar, Palpatine is killed, the poor are freed from Imperial rule.

If I'm right here's my movie:

Getting colder, only chance to survive is a jump-start of the generator, others tried before but their fate is unknown.
not start wars. They still need some figurative stretches to match the description.

Besides, Palpatine doesn't die (or even appear) in the first Star Wars movie, and even in the third, Luke does not kill him. Vader and Palpatine kill each other.

But darn, I was so sure it was V. I mean, the villain is even named "Creedy" for heck's sake

So yeah, I got nothin'. Can't recall any sci-fi movies involving mining right now...
Maybe it's anime ?
He said it was an US production, sci-fi, and famous. Also that the description is "very literal".
elyseum? 10
